com.mordoch.chemtools.util

Class LookupTable

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mordoch.chemtools.util.LookupTable

  • public class LookupTable
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to store information about elements. There are three instance variables that contain Map objects. Upon creation these instance variables are either filled with data or set to null by the constuctor.
    Since:
    0.4
    Version:
    0.5
    Author:
    Ariel Mordoch
    See Also:
    LookupTable(String), LookupTable(), Main

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LookupTable()
      If you want to fill all the Map objects with data, use this constructor.
      LookupTable(java.lang.String desiredMap)
      This constructor fills the map corresponding to the desiredMap argument.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.List<java.lang.Object> data()
      Assembles a List<Object> object containing all the Map objects in this class.

      int getAtomicNumber(java.lang.String element)

      Finds information about an element and then returns a list containing that information.

      java.lang.String getName(java.lang.String element)

    • Constructor Detail

      • LookupTable

        public LookupTable(java.lang.String desiredMap)
        This constructor fills the map corresponding to the desiredMap argument.

        Possible arguments:

        • molarMass
        • atomicNumber
        • name
        Parameters:
        desiredMap - a String corresponding to the map to populate with data

      • LookupTable

        public LookupTable()
        If you want to fill all the Map objects with data, use this constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • data

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Object> data()
        Assembles a List<Object> object containing all the Map objects in this class. It is recommended to avoid using this method as it is an inefficient way of referencing element data, however, it exists for some case where it may be useful.
        Since:
        0.1

      • getElementInfo

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getElementInfo(java.lang.String element)
        Finds information about an element and then returns a list containing that information.

        Format: name, atomic number, atomic mass, molar mass

        Parameters:
        element - a string containing the symbol for an element.
        Returns:
        A List<String> containing information about an element. See format above.
        Since:
        0.1

        public java.lang.String getName(java.lang.String element)
